channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WI

item.title: Report X-2023110343
item.description:
Report X-2023110343

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-05T18:13:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-03
  • City: STURTEVANT
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE DUE TO FROST FORMING AROUND THE BOTTOM OF THE BOX. ADDITIONALLY, THE SHIPPER HAD SENT MANY OTHER PACKAGES THAT WERE MARKED AS CONTAINING DRY ICE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY 10 POUNDS OF DRY ICE PELLETS COOLING CHICKEN. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS INSIDE. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report E-2023110574
item.description:
Report E-2023110574

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-15
  • City: MILWAUKEE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 15, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of acetone was dented by an operator and released approximately fifteen (15) ounces of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from SET Environmental (SET) to remediate the impacted site. SET personnel deployed granular absorbents to the acetone impacted dock and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into three (3) 55-gallon drum to be staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023110531
item.description:
Report E-2023110531

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-14
  • City: JANESVILLE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 14, 2023, two (2) 55-gallon drums of UN1210 were punctured by a forklift and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel utilized oil dry and absorbent pads to remediate the site. All spent oil dry and absorbents were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew placed the two (2) damaged drums into two (2) 85-gallon overpacks for terminal disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023110813
item.description:
Report X-2023110813

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-07
  • City: OSHKOSH
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg was on QA rollers at beginning of AM sort with an inspection required scan (usual process and placement of pkg for us). Sr QA Admin inspected pkg, cutting it open and pulling out all 4 cans; no evidence of leakage but all 4 cans were dented. Pkg put back into sort. Wet bottom on pkg found on 200 belt and was sent to QA. When starting to complete HESS, QA found the UN # on OP-900 did not match the UN # on the cans. Paperwork shows UN1133 (adhesive); can labels show UN1123 (a thinner) which is consistent with the odor of the leakage. DescribePack: 2 of the 4 cans were heavily dented along the bottom seams. Both had pinhole leaks on the bottom. No punctures visible on bottom of shipping box. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Pkg place in plastic tote. QA person opened box and turned the 2 leaking cans upside down to stop the seepage.

item.title: Report E-2023110320
item.description:
Report E-2023110320

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-08
  • City: MILWAUKEE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GREENWOOD MOTOR LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Terminal reports a spill inside trailer OA3086, pro 722679732. (1) 55-G drum of white printing ink arrived on a faulty pallet. The pallet had broke and punctured the drum in transit, (1) pt. released to the pallet. The drum was flipped to prevent more from leaking, no impact to trailer, dock, environment, or waterways. The spill was cleaned and all materials were placed into an overpack for proper disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023110106
item.description:
Report X-2023110106

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-24
  • City: MADISON
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to QA area in a black bin with a plastic liner. Package was leaking yellow paint. DescribePack: Package was crushed and leaking paint. Inside, four 1-gallon cans were dented and spilled yellow paint into package. Cans were packed in packing paper. Cans had multiple body failures and dents, and the tops to their lids were open and leaking. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a black bin with a plastic liner.
